results.title: Gliding
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardner and British Information Services
results.brief_description: The increasingly popular sport of gliding as practiced in Britain today. Air and ground shots demonstrate the skills and techniques for taking-off gaining height, flying and landing. An over-all picture of gliding as a family recreation emerges. Former world champion Philip Wills and Ann Burns, holder of four women’s world records, are seen in action.

results.title: Glider in the sky
results.creator_credit: Bob Lomax and W.D. & H.O. Wills
results.brief_description: A day with gliding club. Checking on weather and air currents. Gliders are towed 2000 feet into thermal air currents.

results.title: Glazing
results.creator_credit: Richard Philps and Educational Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description: The film deals entirely with glazing, demonstrating the techniques of glazing mugs, jugs, dishes and bowls, and the decorative effects that can be obtained. The use of transparent glaze is explained and in addition, extra glazing effects such as matt stoneware glaze and oxides on rough and smooth surfaces are demonstrated.

results.title: Glaucoma: Sneak thief of sight
results.brief_description: Discusses the causes, diagnosis, and control of glaucoma, stressing the urgency of early detection of the disease in order to prevent blindness. Depicts various forms of the disease and includes artwork sequences to explain the anatomy of the eye.

results.title: Glasshouse soils
results.creator_credit: Mary Beales, Jack Chambers and Central Office of Inofrmation Film
results.brief_description: Shows the need for regular sterilisation of glasshouse soils if plant diseases are to be avoided. The methods used at the Cheshunt Experimental and Research Station, England, are described.

results.title: Glasses for Susan a new day
results.brief_description: In an effort to emphasize the importance of good vision in many areas of daily life, this film follows the course of a young schoolgirl as she blunders her way along, ignorant that she has poor eyesight. With the help of an alert teacher she becomes aware of her problem and in the process of acquiring a pair of new glasses she gains a new visual perspective of the world.

results.title: Glass houses
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the responsibility of many social institutions for juvenile delinquency and for measures to reduce it. When a teenage boy is brought to trial for theft, the prosecutor also indicts the agencies of society which helped to shape his character. The church, the school, municipal government and the father are questioned about their efforts to prevent juvenile delinquency. All are found guilty and reminded of their responsibility for the welfare of youth.

results.title: Glass
results.creator_credit: Frank Worth, Cecil Musk and Pilkington Brothers
results.brief_description: An ancient Roman comes to life and tours the Pilkington glassworks. He discovers modern methods of manufacture and the wide range of uses for glass products; in aviation, at home, in industry, science and building. Each item’s use and manufacture is demonstrates (with a streak of comedy to lighten the approach) including the grinding and polishing of lenses, the medieval technique of making glass by hand and mechanical glass blowing.

results.title: The Glacier climbers
results.brief_description: The story of a four day mountain journey from Westland to Canterbury across the Southern Alps. At Malte Brun Hut the climbers meet Sir Edmund Hillary and the parties combine for the last stage of the journey down the Tasman Glacier to the Hermitage, Mount Cook. Includes some spectacular mountain scenes.

results.title: Give yourself the green light
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the inadequacy of roads in the United States and illustrates measures to improve roads and relieve traffic congestion; municipal parking lots; express ways through crowded cities; cross-country super-highways; cloverleaf’s in various section of the country; cities and States matching federal grants for road construction and maintenance.
